questions.title: The Water Cycle
paragraphs: The water cycle describes how water moves above, on, and below the surface of the Earth.
Processes such as evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and runoff drive the cycle.
questions.question: Which process returns water vapor to liquid form in the atmosphere?

questions.title: Photosynthesis Overview
paragraphs: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants and some other organisms use sunlight to synthesize nutrients from carbon dioxide and water.
It generally involves chlorophyll and generates oxygen as a byproduct.
questions.question: What are the main inputs to photosynthesis?

questions.title: Simple Economics
paragraphs: Supply and demand are fundamental concepts in economics.
Price often moves toward an equilibrium determined by supply and demand.
questions.question: If demand increases while supply remains constant, what typically happens to price?
